intro: Dolicholus cunninghamii, commonly known as the Cunningham's dolicholus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
